heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 28 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (183°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (232.0°) by approximately 49.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 1.9°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 6%) and rainfall (up 0.2 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 444 m) and light levels (up 3504 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 4022 lux) and cloud levels (up 415 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 443.6m lower than yesterday, 367.9m lower than the past week, 415.1m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 789m minimum and 3200m maximum, with an average of 1333.3m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1701.2m and 1748.5m.
cloud levels.summary: The sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, air moisture should feel ok and little or no wind. Showers, the sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine, and a mix of sun and clouds. The weather will likely remain the same.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
